summary: Chris Richardson is an experienced software architect and entrepreneur. He provides consulting and training to enable organizations to successfully use the microservice architecture: http://www.chrisrichardson.net/. Chris is currently working on his third startup, Eventuate, Inc (http://eventuate.io), which is building a platform that enables the development of transactional business applications that use the microservice architecture.  His second startup CloudFoundry.com - a Java PaaS - was acquired by SpringSource in May 2009. Chris's first company, Component Systems, which specialized in large scale distributed systems architecture, was acquired by BEA Systems in May 1999.Chris is a Java champion and the author of POJOs in Action, which was published by Manning. He runs the East Bay Java Users Group. Chris is a JavaOne rockstar speaker and speaks regularly at conferences all over the world on software development.
